title: Biden warns that democracy is on the ballot in upcoming midterm elections
description: With less than a week before the US midtern elections, Biden turned Wednesday night to a darker, more urgent message, warning that democracy itself is under threat from right-wing election-denying lies and the violence they inspire.

title: Paris Saint-Germain defeat Juventus in Turin, miss out on top spot in Group H
description: PSG beat the Serie A side 2-1, but have to settle for second place in Group H after Benfica moved ahead on away goals in a 6-1 rout of Maccabi Haifa.

title: Climate activists get a month in prison for protest targeting 'Girl with a Pearl Earring'
description: Prosecutors in The Hague who sentenced the two men for targeting the Vermeer painting said they wanted to send a message to activists to 'keep their hands' off of paintings.

title: French video-based news outlet Brut is seeking profitability, whatever the cost
description: The start-up, which now has 350 employees, including 250 in France, has experienced several setbacks in the past year, like having to downsize its US bureau.

title: 'We are all Putin's emigrants': The exodus of Russian war opponents
description: Long before the rush to the borders triggered by the 'partial mobilization,' tens of thousands of Russians from the educated middle class fled, opposed to Vladimir Putin's regime and his war in Ukraine. Many draw parallels to the early 20th-century mass emigration caused by the Bolshevik Revolution.

title: 'The Peripheral': Between virtual and reality, from one future to another
description: Adapted from the novel 'Peripherals,' the series plays with the themes of gusto, violence and carelessness in contemporary science fiction.

title: Fed unleashes sixth consecutive interest rate hike, hints at a pullback
description: The Federal Reserve delivered another steep interest rate increase on Wednesday, as expected, with its move to cool red-hot inflation taking on more weight ahead of key US midterm elections.

title: Ethiopia warring parties agree to end fighting after two years
description: Both sides in the conflict in Ethiopia's Tigray region have agreed to a permanent cessation of hostilities, after a 2-year civil war that claimed hundreds of thousands of lives.

title: Broken Bells, a duo of master craftsmen, turn pop music into art
description: Singer-guitarist James Mercer and producer-composer Brian Burton release their finely tuned third album, 'Into the Blue.'

title: Argentine dogs granted visitation rights in divorce
description: A court in Argentina, where 80% of the population own pets, has ruled for the first time that animals are sensitive beings that can feel and are affected by the separation of their owners.

title: Poland's first nuclear power plant: 'France's EDF stood little chance of winning against the US's Westinghouse'
description: Poland is set to build its first nuclear power plant, opting to partner with American company Westinghouse, a snub to France's EDF. Poland's Atlanticist leanings weighed on the decision, writes 'Le Monde' journalist Jean-Michel Bezat.

title: France's new immigration bill: 'We want to create a residence permit for jobs with labor shortages'
description: In an interview with 'Le Monde', Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin and Labor Minister Olivier Dussopt unveil what's going into a proposed new law on immigration, set to be debated in early 2023.

title: Ukraine exports resume as Russia rejoins Black Sea grain deal
description: Grain export shipments resumed on Wednesday after Russia announced it would renew its participation in a deal brokered by the UN and Turkey to establish a safe Black Sea corridor.

title: Morocco's king extends invitation to Algerian president for 'dialogue'
description: The date has not been named for this new meeting in Rabat, which comes after an unsuccessful attempt to meet in Algiers this week.

title: The bizarre invention of voter fraud in the United States
description: 'The US midterm elections as seen from my French window': Former US correspondent Gilles Paris discusses how Republicans have taken up the boogeyman of election fraud.

title: CVS Health agrees to $5B settlement of opioid US lawsuits
description: It is the latest in a wave of US pharmacies reaching agreements in connection to the overdose epidemic.

title: UK's Sunak reverses decision and will attend COP27
description: The new PM confirmed on Wednesday that he will attend COP27 after previously saying he would not go.

title: Renewable energy: French government struggles to find a majority on bill
description: While the government is negotiating with all political parties, concessions to reluctant right-wing MPs have alienated their peers on the left.

title: Dean Tavoularis: Giant of cinema sets comes out of the shadows
description: The great Hollywood set designer, who worked with Francis Ford Coppola, Michelangelo Antonioni and Roman Polanski, is the subject of a retrospective at the Cinémathèque in Paris, from November 3 to 11, and of a book of interviews.

title: Olympique de Marseille drops out of Europe, verging on crisis
description: Marseille's last-minute defeat at the hands of Tottenham (1-2) put an early end to the club's European campaign, depriving it of much-needed revenue.

title: In Brazil, Bolsonaro agrees to transition of power, without conceding defeat
description: The outgoing president promised 'to comply with our Constitution,' without formally acknowledging that he lost the election.

title: In Denmark, PM Frederiksen's left-wing bloc snatches election victory
description: The head of government announced at the beginning of the campaign that she wished to form a coalition beyond the blocs and she renewed this call on Tuesday night.

title: The Chinese security apparatus is weaving its web abroad with informal police offices in Paris
description: The discovery of several offices, throughout Europe, supporting the work of Chinese police work testifies to Beijing's surveillance practice abroad.

title: Qatar World Cup: 'The members of the FIFA executive committee saw air conditioning in stadiums as the miracle solution'
description: Former FIFA executive committee member Michel d'Hooghe discusses the climate issue and the change to the World Cup calendar to accommodate for Qatari weather.

title: Social Democrats narrowly win Danish general election
description: After Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen's left-wing coalition won a one-seat majority in parliament, she announced her resignation to try and form a new government with broader support.

title: Europe’s economic sovereignty at play on its markets
description: By relocating its data center from London to Bergamo, Italy, and bringing together seven European markets (Paris, Amsterdam, Brussels, Dublin, Lisbon, Milan and Oslo), Euronext has built a pillar of one of the great unfinished projects of European construction: the union of capital markets.

title: Government interference hinders Iran's start-up sector
description: Most of the stakeholders in the sector who have tried to resist the pressures and threats were forced into exile.

title: Seoul issues shelter warning after North Korea fires three missiles
description: For the 'first time' a ballistic missile fired by North Korea had landed south of the disputed maritime border and close to South Korea's territorial waters.

title: Social Democrats narrowly win Danish general election
description: Amid the fallout from Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen government’s contentious decision to cull millions of minks as a pandemic response measure, the country's left-wing coalition will remain in power after winning a one-seat majority in parliament.
